Module lgarn67.appointmentapp
Package lgarn67.appointmentapp.controller

Class customer_ctlr

java.lang.Object
lgarn67.appointmentapp.controller.customer_ctlr
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class customer_ctlr extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller for the main customer screen. This has a table of all customers, and includes add, edit, and delete appointment buttons.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)

      Initializes the scene and populates the table.

      The lambdas here are to create the onAction for the sidebar and add buttons to change scenes, without the need to have a separate named method:

      • to switch scenes between appointment, customer and report view, with the sidebar buttons;
      • to go to the add customer screen when the button is clicked.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • clickEditCust

      public void clickEditCust(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException
      Gets the ID of the selected customer, if any is selected. THe ID is useed to query the database which is then sent to the edit customer controller. If no appointment is selected prior to pressing "edit", it will have an error message notifying the user.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • clickDelCust

      public void clickDelCust(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException, SQLException
      Deletes the selected customer, if there is a customer that is selected. It will pull the ID of the selected customer. Once deleted, it will clear the Observable Lists in the Working class and then repopulate them. An error message will show up if no customer is selected before pushing delete.
      Throws:
      IOException
      SQLException
